intro: Croton griffithii, commonly known as the Himalayan croton, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and vibrant, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, mountainous regions at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine, and it is also cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance. The species is relatively rare and faces threats from habitat loss and over-collection.
